org.trianacode.taskgraph.service

Interface RunnableInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ClipableTaskInterface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RunnableTask

    public interface RunnableInterface
extends ClipableTaskInterface
    The interface used by Unit to access RunnableTask. RunnableTasks implement the data handling capability of a Task.

    • Method Detail

      • getTask

        Task getTask()
        Returns:
        an interface to the task

      • getControlInterface

        ControlInterface getControlInterface()
        Returns:
        an control interface to the scheduler (returns null if the task is not a control task)

      • isInput

        boolean isInput(int nodeNumber)
        Returns:
        true if there is data waiting on the specified node

      • getInput

        java.lang.Object getInput(int nodeNumber)
                          throws OutOfRangeException,
                                 EmptyingException,
                                 NotCompatibleException
        Returns the data at input node nodeNumber. If data is not ready, NOT_READY triana type is returned. If there is no cable connected to the input node the NOT_CONNECTED triana type is returned.
        Parameters:
        nodeNumber - the node you want to get the data from.
        Returns:
        the data input at node nodeNumber
        Throws:
        OutOfRangeException
        EmptyingException
        NotCompatibleException

      • output

        void output(java.lang.Object data)
        Outputs the data across all nodes. This passses the given data set to the first output node and then makes copies for any other output nodes.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to be sent

      • output

        void output(int outputNode,
          java.lang.Object data,
          boolean blocking)
        Outputs the data to the given node outputNode. If specified this method blocks until the data is successfully sent, otherwise, if non-blocking, isOutputSent() can be used to poll whether the data has been successfully sent. This method is used to set the data at each particular output node if this is necessary, otherwise use output(Object data) to copy the data across all nodes.
        Parameters:
        outputNode - the output node you wish to set
        data - the data to be sent

      • isOutputSent

        boolean isOutputSent(int outputNode)
        Returns:
        true if the data sent with the send call has reached its destination

      • notifyError

        void notifyError(java.lang.String message)
        called by a Unit when an error occurs

      • getToolTable

        ToolTable getToolTable()
        Returns:
        a table of the currently loaded tools
